verse.roman:
kiṁ mayācaritaṁ bhadraṁ
kiṁ taptaṁ paramaṁ tapaḥ
kiṁ vāthāpy arhate dattaṁ
yad drakṣyāmy adya keśavam

synonyms: kim—what; mayā—by me; ācaritam—has been performed; bhadram—good works; kim—what; taptam—suffered; paramam—severe; tapaḥ—austerity; kim—what; vā—or else; atha api—otherwise; arhate—worship performed; dattam—charity given; yat—by which; drakṣyāmi—I am going to see; adya—today; keśavam—Lord Kṛṣṇa.
translation: [Śrī Akrūra thought:] What pious deeds have I done, what severe austerities undergone, what worship performed or charity given so that today I will see Lord Keśava?
